picture.caption: Key Technology Drivers for RFC ▪ High QE for 0.25 - 2 keV band
picture.name: Image15

page.enlisting:
▪ High yield for back-illuminated CCDs ▪ Adequate energy resolution at low Ex – Grating order separation – Particle background rejection ▪ Radiation tolerant at L2 ▪ Stable Calibration – Near room temperature operation – Pile up resistant ▪ High yield for back-illuminated CCDs

page.title:
Cross Section of “Chemisorption-charged” (CC) BI CCD

o f

( C C )
B I
C C D
page.enlisting:
Status of CC Process •Initial Development at U. Arizona (M. Lesser) •Low temp process (130C) •Relies on stable, buried layer of O- ions for backside repulsive field •Appears to be stable long term (>3 years) •Advanced Development at MIT Lincoln Lab in progress •Four lots fabbed thus far; high yields; excellent UV performance •Reference: Burke et al 2003 IEEE Nuc Sci (in press) 10 Å 30 Å Status of CC Process •Initial Development at U. Arizona (M.
